column5: I was thinking of getting a spot in a trailer park for next season. I was wondering if there are any parks that people are really happy with. I like Buckhorn lake. Iâ€™ve seen six foot bay park and it looks nice I would like to check out a couple more if anyone has any recommendations. Good boat docking is important and covered slips would be great if any of them offer that. Thx
Spring Rock on Lower Buckhorn very nice.
My folks (and I) spent almost 40 years at Sandy Beach on Balsam Lake They do have a good boat dock area but they are not covered slips Cheers Andrew
Both Spring Rock and Sandy Beach have zero vacancies for 2021...Stayed at Spring Rock in August and it is a nice park.

A little further South than you might want and no covered slips but Riverwood Park in Lindsay has a pretty good reputation. I live in the 4 season section and love it here. Let me know if you need more information.
Looking into it for you, will have information early this week.

I am in Lonesome Pine Trailer Park on Pigeon Lake. It's a great park. Look on Kijiji and you should see trailers for sale. I don't think there are any empty lots. One advantage they have over other parks is power at some of the boat docks if you need it. Most parks won't allow a generator to charge batteries.

Ok, talked to the owner of Riverwood , they do not have any seasonal openings for 2021 and have a waiting list of 30 to 40 people. They do have some sites that can be rented for weekend's or up to a month but thats it.
